context: In Finnish, 'kuvio' means pattern or design. It is a common noun used to refer to decorative patterns on textiles, wallpapers, and other surfaces. It can also refer to shapes, figures, or designs in a more general sense. The word comes from the root 'kuva' which means picture or image. Kuvio can appear in different contexts including artistic descriptions, design discussions, and everyday observations about patterns in nature or man-made objects.
